# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in split(String(text), r"\s+"))
        if occursin(r"^..$", current_line)) && 
           (length(current_line) + length(word)) > text_width)
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * " "
    end

    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

example_text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
wrapped_string = wrap_string(example_text)

println(wrapped_string)
```
In this code, I defined the `wrap_string` function that takes in a text and an optional text width. It splits the text into words, wraps them onto new lines when the specified width is exceeded, and returns the wrapped string.

The example text provided is:

```julia
example_text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
```

The `wrap_string` function is then called with this example text, and the resulting wrapped string is printed.
